channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Kamala Harris gains ground: New poll shows shifting dynamics in 2024 US election race against Donald Trump
item.description: According to a Reuters/Ipsos poll, Vice President Kamala Harris leads former President Donald Trump 45% to 41%. Harris's support has increased among women and Hispanic voters. Trump continues to lead among white voters and men, although his edge among voters without a college degree has narrowed. Harris sees stronger enthusiasm among Democratic voters.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Elon Musk’s feud with Brazil’s Supreme Court justice: All you need to know
item.description: The Brazilian Supreme Court has issued a warning to Elon Musk's social media platform X, formerly Twitter, threatening suspension if a legal representative is not appointed. This follows repeated failures to comply with orders related to hate speech and misinformation, complicating enforcement of court rulings. X claims this is censorship, closing its offices but keeping services available.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Prince Harry’s secret visit to UK: Duke reunited with brother William at uncle’s funeral — But did they speak?
item.description: Prince Harry and Prince William attended the funeral of their uncle, Lord Robert Fellowes, at St Mary’s Church in Norfolk. Keeping a distance, the brothers did not interact during the service. Lord Fellowes, Princess Diana's brother-in-law, was a former Private Secretary to Queen Elizabeth II and played a significant role in the Royal Household.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Typhoon Shanshan brings torrential rains, travel turmoil across Japan
item.description: Typhoon Shanshan battered Japan with heavy rain and winds, leading to power outages, travel disruptions, and production halts. Millions were advised to evacuate as the storm resulted in fatalities and injuries. Major factories, including those of automakers and electronics firms, temporarily suspended operations. Airlines canceled numerous flights, affecting many travelers.

item.title: Hush money case: Trump seeks federal court intervention in bid to overturn conviction
item.description: Donald Trump's legal team has petitioned a federal court to step in on his hush money criminal case, aiming to reverse his conviction and delay sentencing. They argue that the state-level prosecution breaches his constitutional rights and supreme court rulings on presidential immunity, seeking a transfer to federal court for a fair trial.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US elections 2024: Kamala Harris talks policy, Trump, and future plans along with Tim Walz in CNN interview - Key takeaways
item.description: Kamala Harris, in a CNN interview, emphasized priority shifts from Trump's divisive agenda, focusing on economic reforms and a tax credit for parents. She maintained her stance on fracking, discussed border security, and highlighted Biden's achievements. Harris expressed openness to Republicans and shared personal reflections while defending Biden's leadership and contrasting it with Trump.

item.title: US NSA Sullivan and Xi Jinping seek stable America-China relations amid rising tensions: ‘Competition does not have to lead to conflict’
item.description: Xi Jinping met with US National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan to discuss maintaining open communication amid rising tensions. Both affirmed the need for stable US-China relations, away from conflict. Sensitive topics like Taiwan and China’s support for Russia were discussed, with planned future communication between leaders and military commanders in the Indo-Pacific region.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘We want more babies’: Trump promises free IVF treatments amid abortion rights debate, says ‘US government will pay’ — But how?
item.description: Donald Trump revealed that his administration would ensure insurance companies cover all costs related to IVF treatments. This announcement comes amidst criticism for appointing justices who overturned federal abortion rights. Trump also mentioned a tax deduction for newborn care expenses, highlighting a pro-family stance.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris explains policy shifts and cabinet plans in first interview on CNN: 'My values have not changed'
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris, during an exclusive interview, explained her evolving positions on fracking and immigration while asserting that her core values remain unchanged. She highlighted her commitment to diverse leadership and mentioned the possibility of including a Republican in her Cabinet. Harris dismissed Donald Trump's recent remarks about her racial identity as outdated.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘What do you have to lose?’: Vance booed for questioning union what Democrats have 'gotten you'
item.description: At the Fire Fighters Convention in Boston, Republican VP nominee JD Vance was met with boos after he questioned the union's allegiance to Democrats and promoted the Trump-Vance ticket. He urged reconsideration of political ties, citing economic hardships, while promising labor support, public safety, and opposing COVID mandates.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Ukraine's top pilot killed after US-made F-16 fighter jet crashed during Russian missile attack
item.description: A Ukrainian F-16 fighter jet, recently delivered by NATO allies, was downed this week during a defense against a massive Russian aerial assault, killing the pilot. Ukraine's air force has initiated an investigation into the crash, potentially due to pilot error or mechanical failure, underscoring the intense challenges Ukraine faces.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Editors convicted of sedition in Hong Kong, face upto 2 years in jail
item.description: Hong Kong's court has convicted Chung Pui-kuen and Patrick Lam, editors of the defunct Stand News, for conspiracy to publish seditious articles. They face up to two years of imprisonment when sentenced on Sept. 26. This marks the first sedition conviction in media since 1997's handover, attracting international media critiques.

item.title: 'Curious' 4-year-old boy breaks a 3,500-year-old jar during museum visit
item.description: A 3,500-year-old jar from the Middle Bronze Age on display at Israel's Hecht Museum was shattered when a 4-year-old boy accidentally knocked it over. The museum, which typically allows close visitor access to artifacts, will restore the jar, and the family will be invited back to witness the restoration process.

item.title: Hasina's commerce minister arrested in murder case
item.description: The interim government of Bangladesh has ramped up its efforts against prominent Awami League leaders, arresting ex-commerce minister Tipu Munshi linked to a murder case. Legal proceedings are ongoing against former PM Sheikh Hasina and 52 others at the International Crimes Tribunal, accusing them of crimes against humanity and inciting genocide during student demonstrations.

item.title: 'Same old tired playbook': Kamala fires back at Trump's 'happened to turn Black' comment
item.description: In a CNN interview, Kamala Harris dismissed Donald Trump's comments on her racial identity, calling them outdated. She reaffirmed her consistent values and commitment to serve all Americans. Harris hinted at including a Republican in her Cabinet if elected. This is Harris's first interview since Joe Biden withdrew from the presidential race in late July.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Harris widens her lead over Trump with boost from women: New poll
item.description: Kamala Harris holds a 45% to 41% lead over Donald Trump in a Reuters/Ipsos poll conducted ahead of the November 5 election. The poll reveals strong support for Harris among women and Hispanics, enhancing her standing. Trump retains a lead among white voters and men. The survey gathered responses from over 4,200 adults, including registered voters.

item.title: US court: TikTok must face suit for child's 'blackout challenge' death
item.description: A US appeals court has renewed a lawsuit filed by the mother of a 10-year-old girl who died after trying a TikTok challenge involving self-choking. The court indicated TikTok might be responsible for promoting such content despite federal laws shielding online publishers from liability for user-posted content.

item.title: 'I don't keep track of...':Emmanuel Macron says he was unaware of Telegram CEO Pavel Durov's arrival in France
item.description: President Emmanuel Macron disclosed he was unaware of Telegram CEO Pavel Durov's arrival in France on August 24. Arrested for multiple charges, Durov is being investigated for facilitating criminal activities on his platform. Macron also defended France's decision to grant Durov French citizenship in 2021 under a special procedure for notable individuals. He had earlier clarified that Durov's arrest was part of a judicial investigation and not politically driven.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris says her values have not changed, she'd name a Republican in Cabinet if elected
item.description: In her first interview after being nominated as the presidential candidate which would be telecast live later tonight on CNN, Kamala Harris said her values have not changed. Her time as vice president provided new perspective on some of the issues, Kamala Harris said explaining her change of stance on immigration and fracking, She said she would name a Republican to serve in her Cabinet if elected.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Wells Fargo employee found dead in office cubicle four days after clocking in
item.description: Tempe police are investigating the death of a Wells Fargo employee, Denise Prudhomme, who was found dead at her office after four days. Police have stated that there is no suspicion of foul play, but many details about the exact timing and cause of death remain unclear. The discovery has raised workplace safety concerns and frustration over the lack of timely action. Wells Fargo is cooperating with authorities and offering counseling services to its employees.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
